00047   template<class Scalar> 
00048   class BlockOperator: public Operator<Scalar> {
00049 
00050     friend class OperatorEvaluation<Scalar>;
00051 
00052   protected:
00053 
00054     virtual void applyComponent(int i, 
00055                 const Vector<Scalar> & x,
00056                 Vector<Scalar> & yi) const = 0;
00057 
00058     virtual void apply(Vector<Scalar> const & x,
00059                Vector<Scalar> & y) const {
00060       try {
00061     Components<Scalar> yc(y);
00062     for (int i=0;i<(int)yc.getSize();i++) 
00063       applyComponent(i,x,yc[i]);
00064       }
00065       catch (RVLException & e) {
00066     e<<"\ncalled from BlockOperator::apply\n";
00067     throw e;
00068       }
00069     }
00070 
00072     virtual void applyComponentDeriv(int i, 
00073                      const Vector<Scalar> & x, 
00074                      const Vector<Scalar> & dx,
00075                      Vector<Scalar> & dyi) const = 0;
00076   
00081     virtual void applyDeriv(const Vector<Scalar> & x, 
00082                 const Vector<Scalar> & dx,
00083                 Vector<Scalar> & dy) const {
00084       try {
00085     Components<Scalar> dyc(dy);
00086     for (int i=0;i<(int)dyc.getSize();i++) 
00087       applyComponentDeriv(i,x,dx,dyc[i]);
00088       }
00089       catch (RVLException & e) {
00090     e<<"\ncalled from BlockOperator::applyDeriv\n";
00091     throw e;
00092       }
00093     }
00094 
00096     virtual void applyComponentAdjDeriv(int i, 
00097                     const Vector<Scalar> & x, 
00098                     const Vector<Scalar> & dyi,
00099                     Vector<Scalar> & dx) const = 0;
00100 
00104     virtual void applyAdjDeriv(const Vector<Scalar> & x, 
00105                    const Vector<Scalar> & dy,
00106                    Vector<Scalar> & dx) const {
00107       try {
00108     Components<Scalar> dyc(dy);
00109     applyComponentAdjDeriv(0,x,dyc[0],dx);
00110     if (dyc.getSize()>0) {
00111       Vector<Scalar> tmp(this->getDomain(),true);
00112       for (int i=1; i<(int)dyc.getSize(); i++) {
00113         applyComponentAdjDeriv(i,x,dyc[i],tmp);
00114         dx.linComb(1.0,tmp);
00115       }
00116     }
00117       }
00118       catch (RVLException & e) {
00119     e<<"\ncalled from BlockOperator::applyAdjDeriv\n";
00120     throw e;
00121       }
00122     }
00123 
00125       virtual void applyComponentDeriv2(int i,
00126                                        const Vector<Scalar> & x,
00127                                        const Vector<Scalar> & dx0,
00128                                        const Vector<Scalar> & dx1,
00129                                        Vector<Scalar> & dyi) const = 0;
00130       
00135       virtual void applyDeriv2(const Vector<Scalar> & x,
00136                               const Vector<Scalar> & dx0,
00137                               const Vector<Scalar> & dx1,
00138                               Vector<Scalar> & dy) const {
00139           try {
00140               Components<Scalar> dyc(dy);
00141               for (int i=0;i<(int)dyc.getSize();i++)
00142                   applyComponentDeriv2(i,x,dx0,dx1,dyc[i]);
00143           }
00144           catch (RVLException & e) {
00145               e<<"\ncalled from BlockOperator::applyDeriv2\n";
00146               throw e;
00147           }
00148       }
00150       virtual void applyComponentAdjDeriv2(int i,
00151                                           const Vector<Scalar> & x,
00152                                           const Vector<Scalar> & dx0,
00153                                           const Vector<Scalar> & dyi,
00154                                           Vector<Scalar> & dx1) const = 0;
00155       
00159       virtual void applyAdjDeriv2(const Vector<Scalar> & x,
00160                                   const Vector<Scalar> & dx0,
00161                                   const Vector<Scalar> & dy,
00162                                   Vector<Scalar> & dx1) const {
00163           try {
00164               Components<Scalar> dyc(dy);
00165               applyComponentAdjDeriv2(0,x,dx0,dyc[0],dx1);
00166               if (dyc.getSize()>0) {
00167                   Vector<Scalar> tmp(this->getDomain(),true);
00168                   for (int i=1; i<(int)dyc.getSize(); i++) {
00169                       applyComponentAdjDeriv2(i,x,dx0,dyc[i],tmp);
00170                       dx1.linComb(1.0,tmp);
00171                   }
00172               }
00173           }
00174           catch (RVLException & e) {
00175               e<<"\ncalled from BlockOperator::applyAdjDeriv2\n";
00176               throw e;
00177           }
00178       }
00181     virtual BlockOperator<Scalar> * cloneBlockOp() const = 0;
00182     Operator<Scalar> * clone() const { return cloneBlockOp(); }
00183 
00184   public:
00185 
00186     BlockOperator() {}
00187     BlockOperator(const BlockOperator<Scalar> &) {}
00188     virtual ~BlockOperator() {}
00189 
00191     virtual const ProductSpace<Scalar> & getProductRange() const = 0;
00193     const Space<Scalar> & getRange() const { 
00194       return getProductRange(); 
00195     }
00196   
00197   };

00201   template<typename Scalar>
00202   class TensorOp: public BlockOperator<Scalar> {
00203 
00204   private:
00205 
00206     Operator<Scalar> const & op1;
00207     Operator<Scalar> const & op2;
00208     StdProductSpace<Scalar> rng;
00209 
00210     TensorOp();
00211 
00212   protected:
00213 
00214     void applyComponent(int i, 
00215             const Vector<Scalar> & x,
00216             Vector<Scalar> & yi) const {
00217       try {
00218     if (i==0) this->export_apply(op1,x,yi);
00219     else if (i==1) this->export_apply(op2,x,yi);
00220     else {
00221       RVLException e;
00222       e<<"Error: TensorOp::applyComponent\n";
00223       e<<"index "<<i<<" out of range [0,1]\n";
00224       throw e;
00225     }
00226       }
00227       catch (RVLException & e) {
00228     e<<"\ncalled from TensorOp::applyComponent\n";
00229     throw e;
00230       }
00231     }
00232 
00233     void applyComponentDeriv(int i,
00234                const Vector<Scalar> & x, 
00235                const Vector<Scalar> & dx,
00236                Vector<Scalar> & dyi) const {
00237       try {
00238     if (i==0) this->export_applyDeriv(op1,x,dx,dyi);
00239     else if (i==1) this->export_applyDeriv(op2,x,dx,dyi);
00240     else {
00241       RVLException e;
00242       e<<"Error: TensorOp::applyComponentDeriv\n";
00243       e<<"index "<<i<<" out of range [0,1]\n";
00244       throw e;
00245     }
00246       }
00247       catch (RVLException & e) {
00248     e<<"\ncalled from TensorOp::applyComponentDeriv\n";
00249     throw e;
00250       }
00251     }
00252 
00253     void applyComponentAdjDeriv(int i, 
00254                   const Vector<Scalar> & x, 
00255                   const Vector<Scalar> & dyi,
00256                   Vector<Scalar> & dx) const {
00257       try {
00258     if (i==0) this->export_applyAdjDeriv(op1,x,dyi,dx);
00259     else if (i==1) this->export_applyAdjDeriv(op2,x,dyi,dx);
00260     else {
00261       RVLException e;
00262       e<<"Error: TensorOp::applyComponentAdjDeriv\n";
00263       e<<"index "<<i<<" out of range [0,1]\n";
00264       throw e;
00265     }
00266       }
00267       catch (RVLException & e) {
00268     e<<"\ncalled from TensorOp::applyComponentAdjDeriv\n";
00269     throw e;
00270       }
00271     }
00272   
00273     void applyComponentDeriv2(int i,
00274                             const Vector<Scalar> & x,
00275                             const Vector<Scalar> & dx0,
00276                             const Vector<Scalar> & dx1,
00277                             Vector<Scalar> & dyi) const {
00278         try {
00279             if (i==0) this->export_applyDeriv2(op1,x,dx0,dx1,dyi);
00280             else if (i==1) this->export_applyDeriv2(op2,x,dx0,dx1,dyi);
00281             else {
00282                 RVLException e;
00283                 e<<"Error: TensorOp::applyComponentDeriv2\n";
00284                 e<<"index "<<i<<" out of range [0,1]\n";
00285                 throw e;
00286             }
00287         }
00288         catch (RVLException & e) {
00289             e<<"\ncalled from TensorOp::applyComponentDeriv2\n";
00290             throw e;
00291         }
00292     }
00293       
00294     void applyComponentAdjDeriv2(int i,
00295                                 const Vector<Scalar> & x,
00296                                 const Vector<Scalar> & dx0,
00297                                 const Vector<Scalar> & dyi,
00298                                 Vector<Scalar> & dx1) const{
00299         try {
00300             if (i==0) this->export_applyAdjDeriv2(op1,x,dx0,dyi,dx1);
00301             else if (i==1) this->export_applyAdjDeriv2(op2,x,dx0,dyi,dx1);
00302             else {
00303                 RVLException e;
00304                 e<<"Error: TensorOp::applyComponentAdjDeriv2\n";
00305                 e<<"index "<<i<<" out of range [0,1]\n";
00306                 throw e;
00307             }
00308         }
00309         catch (RVLException & e) {
00310             e<<"\ncalled from TensorOp::applyComponentAdjDeriv2\n";
00311             throw e;
00312         }
00313     }
00314       
00315     TensorOp<Scalar> * cloneTensorOp() const { return new TensorOp(*this); }
00316     BlockOperator<Scalar> * cloneBlockOp() const { return cloneTensorOp(); }
00317 
00318   public:
00319 
00320     TensorOp(Operator<Scalar> const & _op1,
00321          Operator<Scalar> const & _op2)
00322       : op1(_op1), op2(_op2), rng(op1.getRange(),op2.getRange()) {
00323       try {
00324     if (op1.getDomain() != op2.getDomain()) {
00325       RVLException e;
00326       e<<"Error: TensorOp constructor\n";
00327       e<<"input operators do not have same domain\n";
00328       throw e;
00329     }
00330       }
00331       catch (RVLException & e) {
00332     e<<"\ncalled from TensorOp constructor\n";
00333     throw e;
00334       }
00335     }
00336 
00337     TensorOp(TensorOp<Scalar> const & op)
00338       : op1(op.op1), op2(op.op2), rng(op1.getRange(),op2.getRange()) {}
00339 
00340     ~TensorOp() {}
00341 
00342     Space<Scalar> const & getDomain() const { return op1.getDomain(); }
00343     ProductSpace<Scalar> const & getProductRange() const { return rng; }
00344 
00345     ostream & write(ostream & str) const {
00346       str<<"TensorOp: 2x1 block operator\n";
00347       str<<"*** operator[0,0]:\n";
00348       op1.write(str);
00349       str<<"*** operator[1,0]:\n";
00350       op2.write(str);
00351       return str;
00352     }
00353   };

00358     template<class Scalar>
00359     class BlockLinearOp: public LinearOp<Scalar> {
00360         
00361         friend class OperatorEvaluation<Scalar>;
00362         
00363     protected:
00364         
00365         virtual void applyComponent(int i,
00366                                     const Vector<Scalar> & x,
00367                                     Vector<Scalar> & yi) const = 0;
00368         
00369         virtual void apply(Vector<Scalar> const & x,
00370                            Vector<Scalar> & y) const {
00371             try {
00372                 Components<Scalar> yc(y);
00373                 for (int i=0;i<(int)yc.getSize();i++)
00374                     applyComponent(i,x,yc[i]);
00375             }
00376             catch (RVLException & e) {
00377                 e<<"\ncalled from BlockLinearOp::apply\n";
00378                 throw e;
00379             }
00380         }
00381 
00382         
00384         virtual void applyComponentAdj(int i,
00385                                        const Vector<Scalar> & yi,
00386                                        Vector<Scalar> & x) const = 0;
00387         
00391         virtual void applyAdj(const Vector<Scalar> & x,
00392                                    Vector<Scalar> & y) const {
00393             try {
00394                 Components<Scalar> xc(x);
00395                 applyComponentAdj(0,xc[0],y);
00396                 if (xc.getSize()>0) {
00397                     Vector<Scalar> tmp(this->getDomain(),true);
00398                     for (int i=1; i<(int)xc.getSize(); i++) {
00399                         applyComponentAdj(i,xc[i],tmp);
00400                         y.linComb(1.0,tmp);
00401                     }
00402                 }
00403             }
00404             catch (RVLException & e) {
00405                 e<<"\ncalled from BlockLinearOp::applyAdjDeriv\n";
00406                 throw e;
00407             }
00408         }
00409 
00412         virtual BlockLinearOp<Scalar> * cloneBlockLinearOp() const = 0;
00413         LinearOp<Scalar> * clone() const { return cloneBlockLinearOp(); }
00414         
00415     public:
00416         
00417         BlockLinearOp() {}
00418         BlockLinearOp(const BlockLinearOp<Scalar> &) {}
00419         virtual ~BlockLinearOp() {}
00420         
00422         virtual const ProductSpace<Scalar> & getProductRange() const = 0;
00424         const Space<Scalar> & getRange() const { 
00425             return getProductRange(); 
00426         }
00427         
00428     };
00429     
00434     template<typename Scalar>
00435     class TensorLinearOp: public BlockLinearOp<Scalar> {
00436         
00437     private:
00438         
00439         LinearOp<Scalar> const & op1;
00440         LinearOp<Scalar> const & op2;
00441         StdProductSpace<Scalar> rng;
00442         
00443         TensorLinearOp();
00444         
00445     protected:
00446         
00447         void applyComponent(int i,
00448                             const Vector<Scalar> & x,
00449                             Vector<Scalar> & yi) const {
00450             try {
00451                 if (i==0) this->export_apply(op1,x,yi);
00452                 else if (i==1) this->export_apply(op2,x,yi);
00453                 else {
00454                     RVLException e;
00455                     e<<"Error: TensorLinearOp::applyComponent\n";
00456                     e<<"index "<<i<<" out of range [0,1]\n";
00457                     throw e;
00458                 }
00459             }
00460             catch (RVLException & e) {
00461                 e<<"\ncalled from TensorLinearOp::applyComponent\n";
00462                 throw e;
00463             }
00464         }
00465         
00466         void applyComponentAdj(int i,
00467                                const Vector<Scalar> & yi,
00468                                Vector<Scalar> & x) const {
00469             try {
00470                 if (i==0) op1.applyAdjOp(yi,x); //this->export_applyAdj(op1,yi,x);
00471                 else if (i==1) op2.applyAdjOp(yi,x); //this->export_applyAdj(op2,yi,x);
00472                 else {
00473                     RVLException e;
00474                     e<<"Error: TensorLinearOp::applyComponentAdj\n";
00475                     e<<"index "<<i<<" out of range [0,1]\n";
00476                     throw e;
00477                 }
00478             }
00479             catch (RVLException & e) {
00480                 e<<"\ncalled from TensorLinearOp::applyComponentAdj\n";
00481                 throw e;
00482             }
00483         }
00484         
00485         TensorLinearOp<Scalar> * cloneTensorLinearOp() const { return new TensorLinearOp(*this); }
00486         BlockLinearOp<Scalar> * cloneBlockLinearOp() const { return cloneTensorLinearOp(); }
00487         
00488     public:
00489         
00490         TensorLinearOp(LinearOp<Scalar> const & _op1,
00491                  LinearOp<Scalar> const & _op2)
00492         : op1(_op1), op2(_op2), rng(op1.getRange(),op2.getRange()) {
00493             try {
00494                 if (op1.getDomain() != op2.getDomain()) {
00495                     RVLException e;
00496                     e<<"Error: TensorLinearOp constructor\n";
00497                     e<<"input operators do not have same domain\n";
00498                     throw e;
00499                 }
00500             }
00501             catch (RVLException & e) {
00502                 e<<"\ncalled from TensorLinearOp constructor\n";
00503                 throw e;
00504             }
00505         }
00506         
00507         TensorLinearOp(TensorLinearOp<Scalar> const & op)
00508         : op1(op.op1), op2(op.op2), rng(op1.getRange(),op2.getRange()) {}
00509         
00510         ~TensorLinearOp() {}
00511         
00512         Space<Scalar> const & getDomain() const { return op1.getDomain(); }
00513         ProductSpace<Scalar> const & getProductRange() const { return rng; }
00514         
00515         ostream & write(ostream & str) const {
00516             str<<"TensorLinearOp: 2x1 block operator\n";
00517             str<<"*** LinearOp[0,0]:\n";
00518             op1.write(str);
00519             str<<"*** LinearOp[1,0]:\n";
00520             op2.write(str);
00521             return str;
00522         }
00523     };
00524 
00525   /* FO implementation. 
00526 
00527      FOs arranged in BlockFO form. For an n x m BlockOpFO, the apply
00528      FOs are stored in a BlockFO of length n. The nm partial derivs
00529      are stored in a length-n std::vector of BlockFOs of length m, and
00530      adjoint partial derivatives in a length-m std::vector of BlockFOs
00531      of length n (i.e. the transpose structure). Because BlockFOs may
00532      themselves store persistent state, the vectors for deriv and adj
00533      deriv store pointers.
00534 
00535      Each FO in the apply BlockFO should define evaluation for argument
00536      vectors of length m.
00537 
00538      Deriv and adj deriv FOs should define evaluation for vectors of
00539      length m+1, and arg vector should take form
00540      
00541      (x[0],...,x[m-1],dx)
00542 
00543      in which dx is a perturbation of one of the jth input component
00544      for applyPartialDeriv(i,j,...), or of the ith output component
00545      for applyAdjPartialDeriv(i,j,...).
00546 
00547      Additionally provide for extra parameters in the form of
00548      RVL::Vectors, supplied in the form of a std::vector of
00549      pointers. These extra Vectors do not participate in domain or
00550      range definition, but simply parametrize the action of the
00551      FOs. Non-Vector parameters should be passed as member data of the
00552      FOs.
00553   */
00554 
00555     /*
00556   template<typename Scalar>
00557   class BlockOpFO: public BlockOperator<Scalar> {
00558 
00559   private:
00560 
00561     ProductSpace<Scalar> const & dom;
00562     ProductSpace<Scalar> const & rng;
00563     std::vector<FunctionObject *> & f; // F_i
00564     std::vector<std::vector<FunctionObject *> *> & dff; // DF_i/Dx_j
00565     std::vector<std::vector<FunctionObject *> *> & dfa; // DF_i/Dx_j^T
00566     std::vector<RVL::Vector<Scalar> const *> & par; // parameters
00567     BlockOpFO();
00568 
00569   protected:
00570 
00571     virtual void applyComponent(int i, 
00572                 const Vector<Scalar> & x,
00573                 Vector<Scalar> & yi) const {
00574       try {
00575     // standard sanity check
00576     if (x.getSpace() != dom) {
00577       RVLException e;
00578       e<<"Error: BlockFO::applyComponent\n";
00579       e<<"input reference arg not in domain\n";
00580       throw e;
00581     }
00582     if (yi.getSpace() != rng[i]) {
00583       RVLException e;
00584       e<<"Error: BlockFO::applyComponent\n";
00585       e<<"input arg not in component "<<i<<" of range\n";
00586       throw e;
00587     }
00588     Components<Scalar> xc(x);
00589     std::vector< RVL::Vector<Scalar> const * > xv(xc.getSize()+par.size());
00590     for (int j=0;j<xc.getSize();j++) xv[j]=&xc[j];
00591     for (int j=0;j<par.size();j++) xv[j+xc.getSize()]=par[j];
00592     yi.eval(*(f.at(i)),xv);
00593       }
00594       catch (RVLException & e) {
00595     e<<"\ncalled from BlockOpFO::apply\n";
00596     throw e;
00597       }
00598       catch (out_of_range) {
00599     RVLException e;
00600     e<<"Error: out-of-range exception in BlockOpFO::apply\n";
00601     throw e;
00602       }
00603     }
00604 
00605     virtual void applyPartialDeriv(int i, int j,
00606                    const Vector<Scalar> & x, 
00607                    const Vector<Scalar> & dxj,
00608                    Vector<Scalar> & dyi) const {
00609       try {
00610     // standard sanity check
00611     if (x.getSpace() != dom) {
00612       RVLException e;
00613       e<<"Error: BlockFO::applyPartialDeriv\n";
00614       e<<"input reference arg not in domain\n";
00615       throw e;
00616     }
00617     if (dyi.getSpace() != rng[i]) {
00618       RVLException e;
00619       e<<"Error: BlockFO::applyPartialDeriv\n";
00620       e<<"output pert arg not in component "<<i<<" of range\n";
00621       throw e;
00622     }
00623     if (dxj.getSpace() != dom[j]) {
00624       RVLException e;
00625       e<<"Error: BlockFO::applyPartialDeriv\n";
00626       e<<"input pert arg not in component "<<j<<" of domain\n";
00627       throw e;
00628     }
00629 
00630     Components<Scalar> xc(x);
00631     std::vector<RVL::Vector<Scalar> const * > xv(xc.getSize()+1+par.size());
00632     for (int k=0;k<xc.getSize();k++) xv[k]=&xc[k];
00633     xv[xc.getSize()]=&dxj;
00634     for (int k=0;k<par.size();k++) xv[k+xc.getSize()+1]=par[k];
00635     dyi.eval(*((dff.at(i))->at(j)),xv);
00636       }
00637       catch (RVLException & e) {
00638     e<<"\ncalled from BlockOpFO::applyPartialDeriv\n";
00639     throw e;
00640       }
00641       catch (out_of_range) {
00642     RVLException e;
00643     e<<"Error: out-of-range exception in BlockOpFO::applyPartialDeriv\n";
00644     throw e;
00645       }
00646     }
00647 
00648     virtual void applyAdjPartialDeriv(int i, int j,
00649                       const Vector<Scalar> & x, 
00650                       const Vector<Scalar> & dyi,
00651                       Vector<Scalar> & dxj) const {
00652       try {
00653     // standard sanity check
00654     if (x.getSpace() != dom) {
00655       RVLException e;
00656       e<<"Error: BlockFO::applyAdjPartialDeriv\n";
00657       e<<"input reference arg not in domain\n";
00658       throw e;
00659     }
00660     if (dyi.getSpace() != rng[i]) {
00661       RVLException e;
00662       e<<"Error: BlockFO::applyAdjPartialDeriv\n";
00663       e<<"input pert arg not in component "<<i<<" of range\n";
00664       throw e;
00665     }
00666     if (dxj.getSpace() != dom[j]) {
00667       RVLException e;
00668       e<<"Error: BlockFO::applyAdjPartialDeriv\n";
00669       e<<"output pert arg not in component "<<j<<" of domain\n";
00670       throw e;
00671     }
00672 
00673     Components<Scalar> xc(x);
00674     std::vector<RVL::Vector<Scalar> const * > xv(xc.getSize()+1+par.size());
00675     for (int k=0;k<xc.getSize();k++) xv[k]=&xc[k];
00676     xv[xc.getSize()]=&dyi;
00677     for (int k=0;k<par.size();k++) xv[k+xc.getSize()+1]=par[k];
00678     dxj.eval(*((dfa.at(j))->at(i)),xv);
00679       }
00680       catch (RVLException & e) {
00681     e<<"\ncalled from BlockOpFO::applyAdjPartialDeriv\n";
00682     throw e;
00683       }
00684       catch (out_of_range) {
00685     RVLException e;
00686     e<<"Error: out-of-range exception in BlockOpFO::applyAdjPartialDeriv\n";
00687     throw e;
00688       }
00689     }
00690 
00691     virtual BlockOperator<Scalar> * cloneBlockOp() const {
00692       return new BlockOpFO<Scalar>(*this);
00693     }
00694 
00695   public:
00696 
00697     BlockOpFO(ProductSpace<Scalar> const & _dom,
00698           ProductSpace<Scalar> const & _rng,
00699           std::vector< FunctionObject *> const & _f,
00700           std::vector< std::vector< FunctionObject *> *> const & _dff,
00701           std::vector< std::vector< FunctionObject *> *> const & _dfa,
00702           std::vector< Vector<Scalar> const *> const & _par)
00703       : dom(_dom), rng(_rng), f(_f), dff(_dff), dfa(_dfa), par(_par) {
00704       // sanity tests
00705       int m=dom.getSize();
00706       int n=rng.getSize();
00707 
00708       bool testdim = true;
00709       testdim = testdim && (n == f.size());
00710       testdim = testdim && (n == dff.size());
00711       for (int i=0;i<n;i++) 
00712     testdim = testdim && (m == (dff.at(i))->size());
00713       testdim = testdim && (m == dfa.size());
00714       for (int j=0;j<m;j++) 
00715     testdim = testdim && (n == (dfa.at(j))->size());
00716 
00717       if (!testdim) {
00718     RVLException e;
00719     e<<"Error: BlockOpFO construction failed, rows="<<n<<" cols="<<m<<"\n";
00720     e<<"incompatible input FO vectors\n";
00721     throw e;
00722       }
00723     }
00724 
00725     BlockOpFO(const BlockOpFO<Scalar> & a)
00726       : dom(a.dom), rng(a.rng), f(a.f), dff(a.dff), dfa(a.dfa), par(a.par) {
00727       // copy parameter vectors
00728       //      for (int i=0;i<a.par.size();i++) par[i]=a.par[i];
00729     }
00730 
00731     ~BlockOpFO() {}
00732    
00733     virtual const ProductSpace<Scalar> & getProductDomain() const { return dom; }
00734     virtual const ProductSpace<Scalar> & getProductRange() const { return rng; }
00735   };
00736 
00737   */
00738 
00756   template<typename Scalar>
00757   class InjectOp: public Operator<Scalar> {
00758     
00759   private:
00760     
00761     Vector<Scalar> const & ref;
00762     int icomp;
00763     
00764   protected:
00765     
00766     void apply(Vector<Scalar> const & x,
00767            Vector<Scalar> & y) const {
00768       // rely on built-in error trapping
00769       try {
00770     y.copy(ref);
00771     Components<Scalar> cy(y);
00772     cy[icomp].copy(x);
00773       }
00774       catch (RVLException &e) {
00775     e<<"\ncalled from InjectOp::apply\n";
00776     throw e;
00777       }
00778     }
00779 
00780     void applyDeriv(Vector<Scalar> const & x,
00781             Vector<Scalar> const & dx,
00782             Vector<Scalar> & dy) const {
00783       try {
00784     dy.zero();
00785     Components<Scalar> cy(dy);
00786     cy[icomp].copy(dx);
00787       }
00788       catch (RVLException &e) {
00789     e<<"\ncalled from InjectOp::applyDeriv\n";
00790     throw e;
00791       }
00792     }
00793     
00794     void applyAdjDeriv(Vector<Scalar> const & x,
00795                Vector<Scalar> const & dy,
00796                Vector<Scalar> & dx) const {
00797       try {
00798     Components<Scalar> cy(dy);
00799     dx.copy(cy[icomp]);
00800       }
00801       catch (RVLException &e) {
00802     e<<"\ncalled from InjectOp::applyAdjDeriv\n";
00803     throw e;
00804       }
00805     }
00806 
00807     Operator<Scalar> * clone() const { return new InjectOp(*this); }
00808 
00809   public:
00810 
00811     InjectOp(Vector<Scalar> const & _ref,
00812          int _icomp)
00813       : ref(_ref), icomp(_icomp) {}
00814 
00815     InjectOp(InjectOp<Scalar> const & f)
00816       : ref(f.ref), icomp(f.icomp) {}
00817 
00818     ~InjectOp() {}
00819 
00820     Space<Scalar> const & getDomain() const {
00821       try {
00822     ProductSpace<Scalar> const & dom = 
00823       dynamic_cast<ProductSpace<Scalar> const &>(ref.getSpace());
00824     return dom[icomp];
00825       }
00826       catch (bad_cast) {
00827     return ref.getSpace();
00828       }
00829       catch (RVLException & e) {
00830     e<<"\ncalled from InjectOp::getDomain\n";
00831     throw e;
00832       }
00833     }
00834 
00835     Space<Scalar> const & getRange() const {
00836       return ref.getSpace();
00837     }
00838 
00839     ostream & write(ostream & str) const {
00840       str<<"InjectOp object\n";
00841       str<<"component = "<<icomp<<"\n";
00842       str<<"reference vector in output product space:\n";
00843       ref.write(str);
00844       return str;
00845     }
00846   };
00847 }
00848     
00849 #endif
